2.title: Lust

episode of.title: Richard E Grant's 7 Deadly Sins (TV Series 2015– )

2.plot: Richard E Grant explores the evolutionary roots of Lust - the intense, out-of-control craving ... for sex. Animals feel lust too - otherwise species would die out.

3.title: Sloth

episode of.title: Richard E Grant's 7 Deadly Sins (TV Series 2015– )

3.plot: Richard E Grant explores the evolutionary roots of Sloth - pure laziness. What role does it play in nature, which is usually built on fierce competitiveness?

4.title: Gluttony

episode of.title: Richard E Grant's 7 Deadly Sins (TV Series 2015– )

4.plot:

5.title: Envy

episode of.title: Richard E Grant's 7 Deadly Sins (TV Series 2015– )

5.plot: Richard E Grant explores the evolutionary roots of envy - an obsession with the possessions of others. Does it also exist in the animal kingdom?

-1.title: Pride

episode of.title: Richard E Grant's 7 Deadly Sins (TV Series 2015– )

-1.plot: Richard E Grant explores the evolutionary roots of pride. From stag beetles, to gorillas, to hyenas, do animals also display this seemingly human trait?

imdb.plot outline: The award-winning British actor explores the seven deadly sins of the animal kingdom, where greed, gluttony, wrath, lust, sloth, envy and pride are not sinful, but instead a matter of survival. This stunning 2D and 3D series is a new take on the natural history format; drawing on classic literature and sumptuous visuals Richard E Grant's 7 Deadly Sins is a unique look at wildlife's most debauched behavior.
imdb.title: Richard E Grant's 7 Deadly Sins
